explanation: Bimodality persists within hazard/safe classes. GMM prefers 2-component for 100% of MIDDLEs. 9 MIDDLEs remain bimodal after regression. PREFIX choice shifts FL position significantly.

test_summary.explanation: Bimodality persists in all bins including long lines (11/12 bimodal, concordance 0.550)
12/12 bimodal MIDDLEs persist after context stratification; only 0 resolved by context
Weak partition: 1 RIGID, 11 FLEXIBLE, but most are MODERATE (3)
T's gradient failure is explainable by small sample size: 50.6% of random subsamples at n=188 also fail
Within-line forward:backward ratio = 1.3:1 (C786 global = 5:1). Top bigram: l->l (106x)
Full model R²=0.337, residual kurtosis=-1.004. 9/15 MIDDLEs remain bimodal after regression.
12/12 (100%) FL MIDDLEs prefer 2-component GMM, 12 well-separated. Strong dual-state evidence.

Forward bias varies >3x across hazard classes (spread=10.9x). Ratios: HAZARD={'n': 645, 'forward': 404, 'backward': 84, 'same': 157, 'fwd_rate': 0.6264, 'bwd_rate': 0.1302, 'same_rate': 0.2434, 'fwd_bwd_ratio': 4.81}, SAFE={'n': 28, 'forward': 7, 'backward': 16, 'same': 5, 'fwd_rate': 0.25, 'bwd_rate': 0.5714, 'same_rate': 0.1786, 'fwd_bwd_ratio': 0.44}, OTHER={'n': 3093, 'forward': 1091, 'backward': 1055, 'same': 947, 'fwd_rate': 0.3527, 'bwd_rate': 0.3411, 'same_rate': 0.3062, 'fwd_bwd_ratio': 1.03}
Bimodality persists within hazard/safe classes: 11/12 remain bimodal. Dual-state is independent of C773.
PREFIX significantly shifts FL position for 9/11 (82%) of MIDDLEs (p < 0.01). PREFIX selects FL mode.
